lorebooks.name: Orrakhan
lorebooks.creator: That_Dang_Elk

1.name: Orrakhan
1.content:
The Land of Orrakhan

The continent of Orrakhan is a place of contrasts, shaped by mountain, river, forest, and desert. Its regions bear names in Orrakhan Common, spoken across trade routes and cities.

Norrakha (The Verdant North) – Cold forests, tundra, and frozen seas. The name means Green Frost. The Ursine folk thrive here, enduring the long winters. Polar bears keep a harsher, separate culture in the farthest reaches of the north.

Drakthir Spine (The Spine of Orrakhan) – The continent’s central mountain range, its jagged peaks called Dragon’s Backbone in Common tongue. The Mustelidae Kingdoms carved their fortresses here, filling the mountains with halls of stone and forges of metal.

Skathra (The Eastern Deserts) – A vast expanse of shifting sand and sun-scorched stone. The name means Scoured Earth. Reptilian tribes make their homes in loose desert towns, surviving on trade, wit, and memory.

Luthaven (The Greenwild) – Great forests and glades, whose name means Sanctuary of Leaves. The Deer Kingdom rules here, with five clans of stag and elk guiding governance and ritual.

Velka Marshes (The Southern Floodlands) – Marshes, reedlands, and rivers where water and land entwine. The name means Waters Entwined. Otter freeholds prosper here, building their lives around the flow of rivers.

Korveth Steppes (The Western Steppe) – Endless grasslands beneath the open sky. The name means Endless Reach. Here, the Canine peoples roam in nomadic packs, bound by their shared Packsong traditions.

The Celestial Order

The Sun – Bringer of warmth and life.

Varuun (The First Moon) – On a 30-day cycle, Varuun governs the months and short rituals. It is steady and familiar.

Tirrok (The Second Moon) – On a 90-day cycle, Tirrok divides the year into four great quarters. It is mysterious, tied to prophecy, patience, and fate.

The Night of Two Shadows – When both moons are full together. This occurs once every three months at most and is revered as a night when mortal and divine touch. Wolves mark it with song, and mystics across Orrakhan hold vigils.

The Calendar of Orrakhan

The Orrakhan year has 13 months, each ~30–31 days, aligned with Varuun. Tirrok divides the year into four great quarters, with each of its full phases marking a seasonal turning.

The 13 Months (Orrakhan Common)

Varra – Quiet Beginnings: memory, reflection, and preparation.

Drennak – Storms: rains, cleansing, and renewal.

Kolvir – Growth: planting, fertility, and kinship.

Thryss – Hunts: the chase, courage, and the testing of strength.

Morriven – Blossoms: renewal, cycles of life, and the Greenwild.

Grathun – Stone: ancestors, craft, and endurance.

Zairok – Fire: summer’s height, endurance, and trial.

Luneth – Song: sky-gatherings, music, and joy.

Orveth – Harvest: abundance, trade, and feasts.

Feyra – Shadows: lengthening nights, spirits, and remembrance.

Trivane – Frost: winter’s coming, endurance, and kinship.

Veyros – Silence: waiting, patience, and Tirrok’s power.

Ashvar – Endings: closure, debts repaid, and renewal prepared.

Festivals and Rituals

Rites of Varuun – Monthly observances tied to the First Moon’s fullness, marking hunts, plantings, and cleansings.

Quarter Festivals of Tirrok – Grand rituals tied to the Second Moon’s full phase. Each marks a seasonal shift, with different peoples holding distinct celebrations.

The Night of Two Shadows – When both moons are full. Sacred to wolves and mystics, marked by song, visions, and firelit vigils.

Harvest of Orveth – Feasts and gatherings marking the abundance of the harvest, celebrated across species.

Migration of Morriven and Orveth – Cervines migrate through forests and plains, avians take to the skies, and canines follow the herds.

Varra Season – The first quarter of the year (Varra, Drennak, Kolvir), a time of beginnings, quiet observance, and sowing of life.

Peoples of Orrakhan

Mustelidae Kingdoms – Badgers, otters, weasels, and kin. They dwell in the Drakthir Spine, bound to stone, craft, and clan. The badger clan of Brokthak is most ancient.

Reptilian Tribes – Snakes, lizards, turtles, and crocodilians of Skathra. Their tongues include Hissik, Skeltr, Shellon, and Gharok. They thrive on trade, survival, and memory.

Deer Kingdom – In Luthaven, five noble clans rule the forest, each with their own role in governance and ritual. Their speech is lyrical, their traditions deep-rooted.

Canine Packs – In Korveth Steppes, wolves, foxes, coyotes, and wild dogs roam. Though each keeps a tongue of its own, the Packsong binds them.

Avians – High above Orrakhan, they speak Piu’vra, a melodic tongue only they can voice. Their script is universal, read by any who learn it.

Ursines – In Norrakha, bears of strength and endurance dwell. Polar bears keep their own harsher language.

Cervines – Stags, elk, pronghorns, each keeping its own tongue. All honor the migrations.

Small Mammals – Beavers, squirrels, rabbits, raccoons, skunks, and others. Their pragmatic shared language unites them across many lands.

Religion and Myth

The Sun – Life, warmth, and truth.

Varuun – The First Moon, keeper of time and cycles.

Tirrok – The Second Moon, bearer of prophecy, patience, and fate.

Death – The Keeper of the Last Road.

The Creator – Shaper of Orrakhan. Each people tells the story differently.

Fertility – Renewal, abundance, and kinship.

Law – Justice, order, and oath-keeping.

Travel and Migration – Guardian of the wanderer’s path.

Animal Patrons – Wolf, Deer, Badger, Bird, Monitor Lizard, Coyote, and many others. Each species knows its own patron most closely.

The Coyote God – A trickster who deceived the Creator to gain divinity. God of wit, chaos, and survival through cleverness.

Tone of Orrakhan

Orrakhan is a land of many voices, where no single empire rules. The rhythms of Varuun and Tirrok shape the flow of time. Trade cities bring cultures together, yet rivalries endure. The continent’s identity is born of stone halls, forest courts, desert towns, marsh freeholds, and nomadic packs, woven together by ancient traditions and shifting alliances.

2.name: Norrakha
2.content:
Overview

Norrakha, meaning Green Frost in Orrakhan Common, is the northernmost region of the continent. It stretches from deep evergreen forests and rolling tundra to frozen coasts and the endless white of the polar reaches. Life here is harsh, shaped by the rhythm of long winters and brief but fierce summers.

The people of Norrakha are primarily the Ursines, bearfolk who embody strength, patience, and endurance. The land they inhabit is both bountiful and cruel, demanding resilience from all who dwell there.

Geography

The Frostpine Expanse – Endless forests of pine, spruce, and birch, where deer, elk, and wolves roam. Home to most brown bear clans.

The Thrym Tundra – Wide, frozen plains dotted with hardy shrubs and rivers of meltwater. Polar bear tribes endure here in scattered camps.

The Shattered Coast – Jagged cliffs and storm-beaten shores where sea-ice meets black stone. Fishing villages and ursine longships brave its dangerous waters.

The Howling Glaciers – Vast ice fields that groan with ancient weight. Travelers claim to hear voices on the wind here, perhaps of gods or the dead.

People
The Ursines

Brown Bears – The heart of Norrakhan society, living in semi-settled clans along rivers and forests. Known for woodcraft, hunting, and clan feasts.

Black Bears – More solitary, often dwelling in the mountain borders of Drakthir Spine. Renowned for wisdom and mediation.

Polar Bears – A distinct culture, harsher and more warlike. They live in the Thrym Tundra and along the frozen coast, raiding by sea and claiming descent from the White Father (their polar patron deity).

Other Kin – Smaller folk—hares, foxes, and others—live in the shadow of ursine power but often trade and ally with them.

Language

Gravok – The primary Ursine tongue, heavy and deliberate, spoken by brown and black bears. Its words carry weight, often with layered meaning.

Thrymmal – A polar variant of Gravok, harsher and clipped, reflecting the stark tundra life.

Orrakhan Common – Used sparingly in trade with southern merchants. Among themselves, the Ursines prefer their ancestral speech.

Example Phrase (Gravok):

“Gravok thar’un morrak.” – “The strength of the bear endures.”

Society and Clans

Ursine society is clan-based, with leadership held by matriarchs or chieftains who embody strength, wisdom, or lineage. Clans gather for seasonal moots, where disputes are settled and alliances reaffirmed.

Clan Hrovann – Renowned hunters and forest wardens.

Clan Morgrath – Keepers of old stories and rites.

Clan Bryndak – Fisherfolk and seafarers of the Shattered Coast.

The Thrysskaar – Polar bear tribes, bound by blood-oaths and raids, distinct from the forest clans.

Hospitality is sacred; a guest may not be turned away from fire or food in winter, for survival is a shared struggle.

Faith and Belief

The Ursines are deeply spiritual, tying their myths to the frozen land:

The White Father (Polar Patron) – Fierce god of endurance and conquest, honored by polar bear tribes.

The Green Mother (Forest Patron) – Gentle but unyielding, goddess of renewal, fertility, and the forest’s bounty.

The Moon-Kin (Varuun & Tirrok) – Both moons hold great weight in Ursine myth. Varuun represents steady endurance, while Tirrok embodies the unknown and the eternal struggle.

The Keeper of the Last Road – Death, honored in solemnity. Among the Ursines, it is said death is not an ending but a joining with the land itself.

Festivals and Rituals

The First Thaw (Kolvir Season) – When the snows begin to melt, celebrated with feasts and hunts.

The Long Night Vigil (Feyra Season) – A ritual of endurance during the longest night of the year, where clans gather around great bonfires, telling stories until dawn.

The Blood-Ice Hunt (Zairok Season) – Polar bear ritual hunt upon the tundra, both sacred and violent, binding young warriors to their tribe.

The Night of Two Shadows – Held in awe by all Ursines. Wolves may sing, but the bears listen, claiming the shadows reveal the will of the ancestors.

Relations with Other Peoples

Mustelidae – Trade wood, furs, and fish for metalwork and crafted tools. A wary respect exists, for both peoples are tied to stone and endurance.

Deer Kingdom – Peaceful trade, though some clans distrust the forest nobles’ diplomacy.

Canine Packs – Old rivals on the steppe border, though alliances against greater threats are not unknown.

Reptilian Tribes – Rare contact; the desert and frost are too far apart.

Avians – Deep respect for their sky-kin; Ursine shamans often seek omens in birdflight.

Tone of Norrakha

Norrakha is a land of strength and survival. Its people are as enduring as the ice, as patient as the forests, and as fierce as the sea. Life here is not about mastery of the land but coexistence with it, in struggle and reverence. Every firelit hall, every icebound camp, carries the stories of those who endured before.

3.name: Drakthir Spine
3.content:
Overview

The Drakthir Spine, meaning Dragon’s Backbone in Orrakhan Common, is the vast mountain chain that cuts across the heart of the continent. Its jagged peaks rise like serrated teeth, crowned with snow and shrouded in mist. Valleys plunge into shadow, while caverns and rivers cut labyrinths into the rock.

The Mustelidae Kingdoms claim the Drakthir Spine as their ancestral home. Here, the badgers, weasels, martens, and otters carved halls into the stone, raising a society of clan-strongholds, mining holds, and fortified river keeps. To outsiders, the Spine appears forbidding and impenetrable, but to the Mustelidae it is the marrow of their people.

Geography

The Ironmaw Peaks – The highest mountains of the Spine, sharp and sheer, said to be unscalable but riddled with hidden passages.

The Brokthak Halls – Ancient badger strongholds tunneled into the rock, their namesakes echoing with the legacy of Clan Brokthak.

The Shalevales – Valleys where rivers cut deep through the Spine, fertile enough to support otter freeholds and scattered trade towns.

The Emberveins – Cavern systems rich with ore and gemstones, jealously guarded by Mustelidae miners.

The Whispering Deeps – Abyssal caverns filled with subterranean rivers, their echoes mistaken for voices of ancient spirits.

People
The Mustelidae

Badgers (Grondak-speaking clans) – The oldest rulers of the mountains, patient, stubborn, and bound to the stone. They are the builders of fortresses and halls.

Weasels & Martens – Agile and quick-witted, often traders, scouts, and keepers of tunnels too narrow for others.

Otters – Though their great settlements lie in the Velka Marshes, many otters dwell in river-vales of the Spine, bridging stone and water.

Wolverines – Fierce and feared, often acting as enforcers or mercenaries for Mustelidae clans.

Language

Grondak – The primary tongue of the Mustelidae, guttural and clipped, designed to echo in stone halls.

Clan Dialects – Otters speak a softer river-inflected form, while weasels favor faster, sharper variants.

Orrakhan Common – Spoken for trade, but always tinged with the growl of Grondak.

Example Phrase (Grondak):

“Durak groktharn.” – “Stone remembers.”

Society and Clans

Mustelidae society is clan-based, forged in a balance of cooperation and rivalry. Each clan maintains its own halls, mines, and river-ports, but all acknowledge the authority of the Stone Moot, a great gathering of clan-leaders held once every season.

Clan Brokthak – Ancestral badger clan, revered as keepers of tradition and stone.

Clan Skarven – Weasel and marten traders, famed for their craft in metalwork and cunning diplomacy.

Clan Velmorak – Otters of the river strongholds, who ferry trade through the Shalevales.

The Gronthir – Wolverine war-clans, often called upon when strength is demanded above all else.

Faith and Belief

The people of the Spine revere deities tied to stone, labor, and ancestral memory.

The Deep Father – Patron of stone, labor, and perseverance. Badgers hold him as their foremost deity.

The River-Mother – A gentler force, tied to water and sustenance, revered by otters and valley folk.

The Ember-Spirit – A fiery presence within the mountains, representing ore, gems, and the dangerous gift of the forge.

The Silent Ones – Ancestors said to dwell in the caverns of the Whispering Deeps. Shamans claim to hear them speak in the stone’s echoes.

Festivals and Rituals

The Stone Moot – Seasonal gathering of clans, where alliances are sworn and disputes settled under law.

The Ember Rite (Tirvak Season) – A festival where new forges are lit, honoring the Ember-Spirit.

The Water’s Gift (Kolvir Season) – Celebration of river-thaw, especially among otters, marking the start of trade and travel.

The Night of Two Shadows – Considered dangerous by the Mustelidae, for the dual moons are said to open hidden passages into the Whispering Deeps, where spirits may walk freely.

Relations with Other Peoples

Ursines of Norrakha – Strong trade ties in fur, wood, and fish; badgers and bears often share mutual respect.

Cervines of Luthaven – Trade partners, though Mustelidae often distrust cervine nobles as soft.

Canine Packs of Korveth – Relations are strained; steppe raiders and mountain folk often clash.

Reptiles of Skathra – Trade occurs at the edges, but little trust is given to desert-kin.

Avians of Piu’vra – Avians are treated with awe, their flight seen as freedom the stone-bound can never know.

Tone of Drakthir Spine

Drakthir Spine is a realm of endurance, craft, and secrecy. To outsiders, it is a land of impenetrable mountains and unyielding warriors. To its people, it is a living body—stone as bone, rivers as blood, fire as heart. The Mustelidae claim not just to live in the mountains, but to be part of them. Every hall, every forge, every carved wall speaks: Stone remembers.

4.name: Skathra
4.content:
Overview

Skathra, meaning Scoured Earth in Orrakhan Common, is a vast expanse of burning sands, rocky plateaus, and wind-scoured badlands. It is the harshest of Orrakhan’s regions, where water is more precious than gold and survival is won only by cunning and resilience.

The land is claimed by the Reptilian Tribes—snakes, lizards, turtles, and crocodilians—who dwell in scattered desert towns and fortified oases. Skathra is not a land of empires or kingdoms, but of shifting alliances and rivalries, where survival dictates politics as much as pride.

Geography

The Shifting Expanse – Endless dunes of red and gold sand, shifting with the winds, hiding lost ruins and bones alike.

The Stonefang Plateaus – High mesas and broken cliffs, carved with ancient dwellings and tribal fortresses.

The Glass Wastes – A scar of fused sand, said to have been burned by the wrath of gods or by a forgotten war.

The Karrik Oases – Scattered jewels of life, where palm groves, wells, and reed villages provide sustenance. Entire towns rise around these lifelines.

The Serpent’s Maw – A canyon system so deep that sunlight barely touches its floor. Whispers say it is home to ancient reptilian cults.

People
The Reptilian Tribes

Snakes (Hissik-speaking) – Masters of subtlety and persuasion. Snake clans often dominate trade and diplomacy, but are also feared for their cunning.

Lizards (Skeltr-speaking) – Hardy and communal, forming tightly bound desert towns around oases. Known as builders and traders.

Turtles (Shellon-speaking) – Slow but enduring, with settlements built around rivers and wells. They are keepers of long oral histories.

Crocodilians (Gharok-speaking) – Fierce and warlike, holding fortresses on riverbanks and claiming dominion over waterways.

Unlike the clan-halls of the Mustelidae or the forests of the Deer Kingdom, Skathra is united only by necessity. Tribes may ally for a season and turn against one another the next.

Language

Each reptilian folk speaks their own tongue, though a General Reptilian language exists for trade and diplomacy across Skathra.

Hissik – Serpentine, with long sibilants and layered meanings.

Skeltr – Harsh, rapid, reflecting lizard quickness.

Shellon – Slow, deliberate, with deep resonance, mirroring turtle patience.

Gharok – Guttural and booming, suited to the crocodilian roar.

Orrakhan Common – Rarely used, except with merchants from beyond the desert.

Example Phrase (Hissik):

“Ssshrin vakra sseth.” – “Friendship is a sharp blade.”

Society and Towns

Reptilian society is shaped by scarcity. Towns form around oases, rivers, and defensible strongholds, with each tribe claiming territory by force or pact.

The Skeltr Holds – Communal towns where lizard clans cultivate desert crops and maintain trade routes.

The Hissik Circles – Snake gatherings where pacts and plots are woven, often wielding more power than warriors.

The Shellon Wells – Turtle communities built around sacred springs, places of learning and memory.

The Gharok Bastions – Crocodilian fortresses along rivers, enforcing tolls and demanding tribute from travelers.

Despite their rivalries, the tribes hold one shared custom: water is sacred. To poison a well or deny water to a guest is the greatest crime in Skathra.

Faith and Belief

Skathran belief reflects the mercilessness of their homeland:

The Sun-Scourge – Revered as both destroyer and life-giver. Some tribes fear it, others worship it.

The Serpent of Eternity – A coiling god-symbol said to shed its skin as the moons wax and wane.

The Stone Sleepers – Ancestors who rest in the earth, their bones said to lend strength to the land.

The Oasis Mother – A gentle but rare deity, honored where water flows.

Among the crocodilians, blood sacrifice to river-spirits is practiced, while snakes often hold secret rites under the full moons.

Festivals and Rituals

The Drought Vigil (Ravenna Season) – A solemn fast where tribes test their endurance against hunger and thirst.

The Flood Feast (Kolvir Season) – Celebrated when rare rains or floods bless the land, with offerings given to the Oasis Mother.

The Shedding (Zairok Season) – Snake ritual of renewal, where old grievances may be cast aside—or reaffirmed with blood.

The Night of Two Shadows – Considered deeply dangerous. Skathran mystics say the dual moons awaken the Serpent of Eternity, and many tribes refuse to travel at this time.

Relations with Other Peoples

Mustelidae of Drakthir Spine – Limited trade, but mistrust runs deep. Mountain folk see desert-kin as untrustworthy, while reptiles see them as greedy for ore and stone.

Ursines of Norrakha – Rare contact. The frozen north and the burning desert share little, though reptilian traders occasionally travel to exchange salt for furs.

Cervines of Luthaven – Some trade through forest borders, but deer clans often see Skathra as a land of raiders and tricksters.

Canines of Korveth – Frequent conflict, as nomadic packs and reptilian caravans vie for control of borderlands.

Avians of Piu’vra – Viewed with awe and suspicion, as their command of the skies contrasts with reptilian earthbound endurance.

Tone of Skathra

Skathra is a land of survival, secrecy, and shifting power. Its people are as dangerous as they are enduring—snakes whisper in shadows, lizards build stubbornly against the desert winds, turtles remember what others forget, and crocodilians strike with sudden ferocity. To live in Skathra is to sharpen one’s will like a blade, for the desert tests all, and only the strong—or the cunning—endure.

5.name: Luthaven
5.content:
Overview

Luthaven, meaning Sanctuary of Leaves in Orrakhan Common, is a vast expanse of temperate forests, sun-dappled glades, and winding rivers. It is the heartland of fertility and life on Orrakhan, where towering trees create endless shade, and the forest floor teems with flora and fauna.

Luthaven is dominated by the Deer Kingdom, whose noble clans govern the woods with a mix of ritual, council, and tradition. Unlike the harsh lands of Skathra or Norrakha, Luthaven thrives in abundance, but its beauty conceals the constant vigilance required to maintain harmony among the forest clans.

Geography

The Eldergrove – Ancient, dense woods filled with towering oaks and silver-barked birch. Sacred sites of the Deer Kingdom are hidden here.

The Silver Glades – Open meadows where sunlight floods the forest floor, allowing herds to graze and deer to perform ritual dances.

The Winding Rivers – Numerous rivers and streams carve paths through the forest, serving as both highways for trade and natural boundaries between clans.

The Thornmarch – Dense underbrush and bramble-filled forests, considered dangerous for outsiders. Used by smaller clans and hunters for concealment.

The Moonshadow Hills – Rolling hills where the moons’ light is most pronounced, sacred for nocturnal ceremonies.

People
The Deer Kingdom

Stags (Rhonval-speaking) – Noble leaders, ceremonial kings, and guardians of the forest. Their antlers mark rank and lineage.

Hinds (Feylune-speaking) – Keepers of domestic life, ritual, and the preservation of the forest’s bounty.

Elk (Grontar-speaking) – Wardens of the rivers and hills, skilled in both defense and diplomacy.

Pronghorn (Skelvan-speaking) – Scouts and messengers, quick and adaptable across the glades.

Reindeer/Caribou (Lúthverin-speaking) – Nomadic hunters within the Deer Kingdom, keeping traditions of migration alive.

The five clans of the Deer Kingdom maintain balance through councils, festivals, and mutual respect. Each clan brings a unique strength: leadership, vigilance, craft, lore, or martial skill.

Language

The Deer Kingdom has five primary tongues, reflecting the clans and species:

Feylune – Gentle, flowing, used in rituals and daily conversation among hinds.

Rhonval – Strong and deliberate, spoken by stags in leadership and diplomacy.

Grontar – Deep and resonant, for communicating across forests and rivers.

Skelvan – Quick and clipped, suited to scouts and messengers.

Lúthverin – Nomadic dialect, incorporating elements from trade and distant clans.

Orrakhan Common – Learned by nobles and traders but less common than the native tongues.

Example Phrase (Feylune):

“Lureth vinor selah.” – “The forest watches and remembers.”

Society and Clans

The Deer Kingdom is organized around five clans, each tied to a geographic or functional aspect of Luthaven:

Clan Eldergrove – Guardians of sacred groves and ancient trees.

Clan Silverhoof – Masters of the meadows, responsible for ceremonial dances and harvest rites.

Clan Riverstride – Wardens of rivers and bridges, keeping communication open.

Clan Thornhart – Hunters and warriors, experts in concealment and defense.

Clan Moonshadow – Mystics, diviners, and keepers of lunar rituals.

Clans meet in council at festivals, during seasonal migrations, and to resolve disputes. Leadership is a combination of merit, ritual, and lineage, ensuring that power is distributed among clans rather than centralized.

Faith and Belief

The Green Mother (Forest Patron) – Goddess of growth, renewal, and harmony. The central deity of the Deer Kingdom.

The Horned Father (Hunting Patron) – Guardian of the hunt, honor, and courage.

The Moon-Kin (Varuun & Tirrok) – Both moons are central to Deer Kingdom ritual. Varuun represents order and cycles, Tirrok embodies foresight and prophecy.

The Keeper of the Last Road – Death is honored as a passage back to the forest, ensuring life continues.

Ancestral Spirits – Each clan venerates its own ancestors, believed to walk the glades in subtle forms.

Festivals and Rituals

Blossom Renewal (Morriven Season) – Celebration of growth and fertility in the Silver Glades. Ritual dances and offerings to the Green Mother.

Riverbound Gathering (Kolvir Season) – Clan Riverstride hosts feasts and games to honor flowing waters and trade.

The Hunt of Thryss – Martial festival of skill and courage, honoring the Horned Father.

Night of Two Shadows – A sacred nocturnal ritual; mystics and Moonshadow clan members gather in the Moonshadow Hills to interpret the dual moons’ portents.

Harvest of Orveth – Communal gathering marking abundance; all clans contribute produce, meat, and craft.

Relations with Other Peoples

Mustelidae of Drakthir Spine – Cooperative trade, often exchanging forest goods for stone tools and metals.

Ursines of Norrakha – Generally peaceful relations; deer provide wood, herbs, and guidance through forests, while bears provide protection or muscle.

Canines of Korveth – Occasional conflict along steppe borders; negotiation and ritual combat maintain balance.

Reptiles of Skathra – Rare contact due to distance, though trade occasionally occurs at desert margins.

Avians of Piu’vra – High respect for avian observation; messages and omens from the sky are taken seriously.

Tone of Luthaven

Luthaven is a land of balance, abundance, and vigilance. Its forests are generous but demand respect. Every river, glade, and hill is watched by the Deer Kingdom, where tradition, ritual, and council govern life. To dwell here is to live in harmony with the cycles of nature and the flow of time, guided always by the light of Varuun and the prophecy of Tirrok.

6.name: Velka Marshes
6.content:
Overview

Velka Marshes, meaning Waters Entwined in Orrakhan Common, are the vast southern wetlands of Orrakhan, where rivers, lakes, and reed-choked marshes interlace in a living network of water and land. The region is lush, fertile, and teeming with life, but its terrain is treacherous to outsiders unaccustomed to wading through marshes or navigating winding waterways.

The marshes are primarily inhabited by otters, who maintain freeholds along the rivers, building their homes on stilts or floating platforms. Velka is also home to amphibious and small mammal communities that coexist with the otters, forming a society that prizes cooperation, craft, and knowledge of the waterways.

Geography

The Riverweb – A dense network of slow-flowing rivers, channels, and backwaters that form the lifeblood of the region.

The Reedlands – Tall grasses and reeds cover large swaths of the marshes, providing cover for wildlife and hiding the entrances to hidden villages.

The Fenhollows – Small dry elevations amid the wetlands where trading posts, marketplaces, and freeholds are built.

The Glistening Pools – Shimmering lakes reflecting the sun and moon, sacred to water spirits and often the site of rituals.

The Misted Expanse – Low-lying fog-covered marshes that conceal wildlife, paths, and sometimes danger.

People
The Otter Freeholds

Riverfolk Otters (Orrakhan Mustelid dialect) – Skilled in watercraft, fishing, and trade. Freeholds are often semi-autonomous, with a council of elders guiding the community.

Traders and Artisans – Otters specialize in crafts from reeds, wood, and river-clay, producing tools, vessels, and textiles.

Small Mammals – Beavers, raccoons, muskrats, and marsh hares live alongside the otters. They cooperate in constructing waterways, defenses, and communal projects.

Otters value cooperation above all, and disputes are settled in council, with compromise and consensus preferred over force.

Language

Otter Tongue (Brokthak-derived Mustelid dialect) – Fluid, flowing, and often rhythmic, reflecting the movement of water.

Small Mammal Dialects – Variants evolved to suit quick communication over reeds, water, and dense foliage.

Orrakhan Common – Used for trade and negotiation with other peoples, though freeholds remain primarily insular.

Example Phrase (Otter Tongue):

“Vrenkha sura kalith.” – “Water binds us together.”

Society and Freeholds

Velka Marshes is organized around freeholds, semi-autonomous communities led by councils of elders, chief artisans, and river captains.

Brokthak Freeholds – Named after the ancestral badger clan, their influence stretches into Drakthir Spine trade routes.

Rivercall – Otter strongholds positioned along major rivers for commerce and defense.

The Fenhollow League – Alliance of smaller marsh communities, pooling resources to maintain waterways and trade channels.

Social cohesion is emphasized; cooperation ensures survival, especially during flooding, drought, or incursions by outsiders.

Faith and Belief

The River-Mother – Primary deity of the marshes, goddess of flowing waters, fertility, and abundance.

The Mist Spirits – Protective spirits said to guard the marshes, confusing trespassers and guiding lost travelers.

The Keeper of the Last Road – Death is revered as a journey along the rivers to the afterlife, with each river believed to carry spirits to the beyond.

Ancestors of the Freeholds – Every freehold maintains shrines to ancestors, often at riverbanks or pools, to honor guidance and blessings.

Festivals and Rituals

Flowing Light (Kolvir Season) – Celebration of thawing rivers and the start of trading season. Offerings are made to the River-Mother.

The Mist Vigil (Feyra Season) – Honoring the unseen spirits of the marsh; elders perform rituals to ensure safe passage through the fog.

The Glistening Hunt (Thryss Season) – Seasonal fishing and hunting festival, testing skill and endurance.

Night of Two Shadows – Observed carefully; otters believe the dual moons influence tides and may awaken water spirits.

Harvest of Orveth – Collecting reeds, crops, and fish, marking abundance and communal wealth.

Relations with Other Peoples

Mustelidae of Drakthir Spine – Strong ties for trade in crafted goods, stone, and metals. Otters often act as intermediaries between mountain folk and other regions.

Ursines of Norrakha – Occasional trade in furs, fish, and forest goods. Relations are generally cordial.

Deer of Luthaven – Limited trade along river borders; deer provide forest products and guidance.

Canines of Korveth – Tensions exist along floodplain borders, as nomadic packs occasionally hunt or raid near waterways.

Reptiles of Skathra – Trade in salt, spices, and rare minerals occurs along southern desert borders.

Avians – Seen as observers of tides and winds; otters respect avian guidance for travel and weather prediction.

Tone of Velka Marshes

Velka Marshes is a land of patience, vigilance, and interdependence. Life flows with the rhythm of water, and communities thrive through cooperation and knowledge of their environment. Outsiders may find it labyrinthine, treacherous, and slow-moving, but the otters and small mammals of the marsh know every reed, current, and pool. In Velka, survival is never solitary—water binds all together.

7.name: Korveth Steppes
7.content:
Overview

Korveth Steppes, meaning Endless Reach in Orrakhan Common, are vast open plains that stretch to the horizon under an ever-changing sky. Winds sweep freely over the tall grasses, and herds of herbivores roam across the land in great migrations.

The Steppes are dominated by Canine Packs—wolves, foxes, coyotes, and wild dogs—whose culture is nomadic, tightly bound by Packsong traditions. Life here is defined by mobility, cooperation, and survival in an environment where speed and endurance determine success.

Geography

The Windsea Plains – Rolling grasslands, where herds of deer, antelope, and smaller cervines provide sustenance for pack hunters.

The Howling Flats – Open expanses exposed to winds that carry pack songs across miles. Rituals and communication rely heavily on sound here.

The Riverbend Corridors – Fertile river valleys cutting across the steppe, vital for water and seasonal hunting grounds.

The Korrath Hills – Low, rugged hills used by scouts for observation and as safe havens during storms or raids.

The Amber Grasslands – The southernmost plains where grasses take golden hues and wildflowers bloom in seasonal abundance.

People
The Canine Packs

Wolves (Vorruln-speaking) – Strong pack leaders and hunters, masters of coordinated hunting and survival strategies.

Foxes (Kivran-speaking) – Cunning scouts, traders, and spies; skilled in trickery and observation.

Coyotes (Vorruln-adjacent dialect) – Tricksters and diplomats, revered for intelligence and adaptability.

Other Wild Dogs – Smaller nomadic groups who integrate into larger packs for survival.

Pack life is defined by loyalty, hierarchy, and tradition. Each pack is a microcosm of governance, discipline, and ritual, and leadership is earned through skill, wisdom, and the guidance of Packsong.

Language

Vorruln – The primary pack tongue, evolved from wolf speech; tonal and rhythmic, used in hunting coordination and ritual.

Kivran – Fox dialect, clever, precise, and suited for rapid communication.

Common Canine Phrases – Coyotes and smaller wild dogs adapt elements of both for diplomacy and trade.

Orrakhan Common – Learned by pack leaders for negotiation with distant peoples, though rarely spoken by ordinary hunters.

Example Phrase (Vorruln):

“Ravna korthal ven.” – “Strength binds the pack.”

Society and Packs

The steppes are divided among numerous packs, each with its own territory, hunting routes, and seasonal migrations.

Clan Fenra – Wolf pack famed for its martial tradition and discipline.

Clan Soryn – Fox pack, masters of scouting, trade, and cunning strategies.

Clan Tirvek – Coyote-led nomads, skilled in negotiation and intelligence-gathering.

The Wildborn – Independent groups that often ally with stronger packs during harsh winters.

Hierarchy is based on merit, age, and ritual challenge. Leadership changes with consensus, combat, or symbolic hunts, ensuring the pack remains strong and adaptable.

Faith and Belief

The Hunt Spirit – Patron of survival, strategy, and honor in hunting. Wolves and foxes alike honor it through ritual hunts.

The Moon-Kin (Varuun & Tirrok) – Wolves especially track lunar cycles; full moons influence hunting strategies, rituals, and Packsong ceremonies.

The Trickster (Coyote God) – Revered as a teacher of cunning, adaptability, and survival through wit.

The Keeper of the Last Road – Death is honored as a passage back to the Steppe, where ancestors roam with the wind.

Festivals and Rituals

The Great Hunt (Thryss Season) – Seasonal coordinated hunt to feed packs, honoring the Hunt Spirit and teaching young hunters.

Song of the Wind (Luneth Season) – Celebration of communication and coordination, where packs teach young to harmonize in Packsong.

The Night of Two Shadows – Observed with caution; dual moons are believed to heighten perception and the risk of predatory danger.

The Migration Rite (Morriven Season) – Packs follow herds in ritualistic migration, ensuring survival and reinforcing social bonds.

Harvest of Orveth – Focused on preparation for winter, storing meat, and strengthening community ties.

Relations with Other Peoples

Deer of Luthaven – Steady predators and competitors; some peaceful interaction occurs during migrations and forest borders.

Mustelidae of Drakthir Spine – Rare contact; mutual respect exists, often through trade of tools and crafted goods.

Ursines of Norrakha – Occasional territorial conflicts, especially near northern borders.

Reptiles of Skathra – Limited contact; coyote scouts sometimes trade or observe desert caravans.

Otters of Velka Marshes – Generally peaceful; river corridors are used for seasonal movement and trade.

Avians of Piu’vra – Highly respected; flight is admired, and messages from the sky are often interpreted as omens.

Tone of Korveth Steppes

Korveth is a land of freedom, mobility, and vigilance. Life is governed by rhythm—herds, wind, and moon cycles dictate daily survival. The steppe’s openness leaves no place to hide, fostering cooperation and cunning within packs. Strength, cunning, and loyalty determine destiny here, and the pack is everything. Outsiders may see only grass and sky, but every dune, river, and hill carries the memory and strategy of countless generations.

8.name: Vorr
8.content:
Common Name:  Vorr (singular and plural)

Language: Vorruln (spoken), ancient runic-based script (written)
Region: Primarily found in the Drakthir Spine mountains and the Korveth Steppes; nomadic packs sometimes reach the edges of Luthaven forests.

Society & Culture

Wolves, or Vorr, are apex predators with complex social structures. Packs are the core of their society, consisting of a strict hierarchy led by an Alpha Pair (Alpha Male: Varkun, Alpha Female: Varkra). Packs average 8–15 members, though large territories can support 20–30.

Hierarchy:

Varkun / Varkra – Leaders, decision-makers, spiritual mediators.

Beta / Subordinate adults – Guardians and hunters, assist in training young and maintaining pack order.

Omega / Initiates – Young adults or newcomers, often responsible for tasks that maintain social cohesion.

Pack Roles: Each wolf is trained from birth to understand hunting, scouting, and protection roles. Wolves exhibit a highly ritualized communication system, both verbal and body-language-based.

Nomadic Lifestyle: Vorr adapt to seasons; packs follow prey migrations across Korveth Steppes in winter and shelter in the Drakthir Spine in summer.

Religion & Spirituality

Vorr worship is deeply connected to moons and pack spirits. Their two moons are central to spiritual life:

First Moon (Feylune) – Guides hunting cycles; full moon nights are sacred hunting rites.

Second Moon (Rhonval) – Governs spiritual reflection and ancestral connection; its 3-month cycle marks pack ceremonies.

Rituals often involve “Night of the Twin Moons”, when both moons align. Packs gather to howl in unison, believed to honor the Creator and their ancestors, strengthening bonds and hunting intuition.

Language: Vorruln

Vorruln is a tonal and guttural language, designed to carry over long distances. It emphasizes pitch, rhythm, and howls. The written script consists of angular runes, usually carved on stone, wood, or bone.

Common Phrases:

Greeting / Bonding: “Kivran thal” → “Strength to your pack”

Acknowledging a Leader: “Varkun shal” → “I honor the Alpha”

Farewell: “Fey tharn” → “Until the next hunt”

Example Sentence:
"Vorr ulkthar Kivran" → “The pack hunts together.”

Hunting & Survival

Wolves are expert hunters, using stealth, endurance, and coordinated strategies. Packs teach younger members through ritual hunts, gradually introducing them to real prey. The prey ranges from steppe deer to forest elk, depending on the season.

Wolves have keen night vision and rely heavily on scent and sound.

Howling is used not just for communication but for coordination during hunts across great distances.

Interactions with Other Species

Wolves are territorial but often trade knowledge or hunt jointly with coyotes in sparse regions.

Avoid large predators like ursine (polar bears, grizzly types) unless in large packs.

In rare instances, Vorr interact with humanoids for mutual benefit but maintain a wary distance.

Rituals & Festivals

Twin Moon Night: Full moons align; pack gathers to honor ancestors, howl, and reaffirm bonds.

Seasonal Hunts: Marks the start of migration or hunting cycles, sometimes including mock battles to train the young.

Ancestral Remembrance: Bones and carved runes left in sacred sites to honor fallen pack members.

9.name: Kiv
9.content:
Common Name: Foxes
Self-Name (in their language): Kiv (singular and plural)
Language: Kivran (spoken), pictographic-symbolic script (written)
Region: Forested edges of Luthaven, the Korveth Steppes, and scattered burrows near Velka Marshes.

Society & Culture

Foxes are solitary or loosely-knit family units, rather than large packs. Their society revolves around cleverness, adaptability, and stealth.

Hierarchy: Fox society is mostly egalitarian within families, but elders and the most cunning individuals hold informal influence.

Family Units: A family (Kivra) usually consists of parents and their last two litters. They communicate and hunt collaboratively, but young adults often disperse to form new territories.

Territory: Each Kiv maintains a territory that it defends primarily through marking, stealth, and observation rather than direct conflict.

Religion & Spirituality

Foxes are deeply spiritual, worshipping trickster and shadow deities alongside natural spirits:

Moon Deity (Lúthverin) – Governs night activities, cleverness, and the changing of seasons.

Fertility & Trickster Spirits – Revered in small household rituals, often involving tokens, clever riddles, or minor mischief.

Key rituals include:

Moonlit Clevering: Young foxes demonstrate cunning through puzzles or hunting tests under the first moon.

Shadow’s Gift: Seasonal offerings to spirits to ensure survival during harsh winters or plentiful harvests.

Language: Kivran

Kivran is soft, quick, and melodic, filled with sharp consonants and short vowel sounds to allow rapid communication.

Written Kivran is pictographic, often carved into tree bark or etched into stones near dens. Each symbol can convey multiple meanings, emphasizing context and inference.

Spoken Kivran relies on intonation, pitch, and subtle vocal cues, ideal for silent communication when hunting.

Common Phrases:

Greeting / Bonding: “Sihl’ka” → “Bright paths to you”

Acknowledging Wisdom: “Rúv kael” → “Your cleverness is honored”

Farewell: “Niv thal” → “Until our trails cross again”

Example Sentence:
"Kiv rúv thal Sihl’ka" → “The fox observes the path ahead.”

Hunting & Survival

Foxes are opportunistic hunters, excelling in stealth and ambush.

Diet includes small mammals, birds, eggs, insects, and seasonal fruits.

They are nocturnal or crepuscular, often hunting under cover of darkness using sharp senses of smell, sight, and hearing.

Unlike wolves, foxes rely more on strategy than strength, often luring prey into traps or isolated locations.

Interactions with Other Species

Foxes are cautious and opportunistic, avoiding direct conflict with larger predators like wolves, bears, or large raptors.

They sometimes scavenge or steal from wolves, using cleverness to escape notice.

Foxes are curious about other species and may observe humanoids or other animals, sometimes imitating behaviors to survive or gain advantage.

Rituals & Festivals

Moonlit Clevering: Ceremony to showcase cunning, often coinciding with the first moon.

Shadow Hunt: Seasonal festival where fox families engage in mock hunts or stealth competitions, training the young in survival skills.

Offering of the Hidden: Small objects, food, or tokens are left in secret places as thanks to spirits or ancestors.

Traits & Characteristics

Cunning & Intelligent: Foxes value mental skill over physical strength.

Agile & Adaptive: Their survival depends on flexibility, stealth, and improvisation.

Communal but Independent: Families work together, but individuals maintain personal freedom.

10.name: Vish
10.content:
Common Name: Coyotes
Self-Name (in their language): Vish (singular and plural)
Language: Vishkar (spoken), flowing sigil-based script (written)
Region: Open plains of the Korveth Steppes, outskirts of the Velka Marshes, and lower valleys of the Drakthir Spine.

Society & Culture

Coyotes are opportunistic, adaptable, and highly social. Unlike wolves, they favor looser packs with fluid hierarchies that shift depending on need.

Hierarchy:

Elder Vish (Shar’kan) – Leaders or mediators; often the oldest, wisest members of a pack.

Hunters / Scouts (Vish’thar) – Primary contributors to survival; skilled in tracking and ambushing prey.

Runners / Tricksters (Vish’len) – Young adults or subordinates; specialize in reconnaissance, diversion, and cunning tactics.

Pack Dynamics: Packs range from 5–12 individuals, but several packs may cooperate temporarily for larger hunts or territorial disputes.

Territorial Behavior: Vish are highly territorial, marking boundaries with scent and vocal warnings, but they avoid unnecessary conflict with larger predators.

Religion & Spirituality

Coyotes are deeply connected to trickster spirits, travel deities, and the Creator god.

Primary Deity (Coyote Creator / Trix’kan): A clever, shape-shifting entity who tricked the Creator god into granting it divinity; teaches adaptability, cunning, and survival.

Moon Observances: Coyotes honor the second moon (Rhonval), which governs migration and spiritual journeys.

Migration Festivals: Seasonal ceremonies celebrate the pack’s endurance and unity while traveling long distances for prey.

Rituals:

Shadow Migration: Elders lead young on a test of endurance and cunning along seasonal routes.

Lunar Howling: On full moons, packs perform coordinated howls to honor Trix’kan and communicate across territories.

Language: Vishkar

Vishkar is fluid, musical, and highly context-dependent, combining vocal tones, yips, and subtle body cues.

Written Vishkar consists of flowing sigils, each representing concepts or ideas rather than strict phonetic sounds.

Tone is crucial; the same word with different intonation can express warning, humor, or agreement.

Common Phrases:

Greeting / Bonding: “Sha’lin” → “May your path be swift”

Acknowledging Skill: “Vish’thar kael” → “Your cunning is respected”

Farewell: “Thal’vish” → “May the winds guide you”

Example Sentence:
"Vish ulkthar Sha’lin" → “The pack moves with purpose.”

Hunting & Survival

Coyotes are strategic hunters who prefer speed, cunning, and cooperation over brute strength.

Prey includes small to medium mammals, birds, eggs, and occasionally scavenged kills from larger predators.

Hunting style emphasizes ambush, distraction, and lure techniques.

Vish are expert long-distance travelers, capable of covering dozens of kilometers in a single day.

Interactions with Other Species

Coyotes are pragmatic and opportunistic in their interactions.

They may cooperate with foxes or lone wolves when mutual benefit arises.

They avoid direct conflict with larger predators like bears but are known to steal kills from unwary packs.

Rituals & Festivals

Shadow Migration: Seasonal rite marking long pack journeys, training the young in endurance and cooperation.

Lunar Howling Festival: Coordinated howl during the full moon to honor Trix’kan and communicate across territories.

Trickster’s Challenge: Young coyotes engage in playful tests of wit and strategy under the guidance of elders.

Traits & Characteristics

Clever & Opportunistic: Survival depends on adaptability and strategy.

Fast & Enduring: Built for long-distance travel and ambush hunting.

Flexible Social Structure: Packs are cooperative but dynamic, adapting to circumstances.

lorebooks.name: A lorebook specifically made to cover the lore of Arun/Amadeo/Armand from IWTV
lorebooks.website_description: Probably important to mention I have not read the books... Only watched the show. This lorebook may take from the books but is mostly based on what Armand has said in show.
lorebooks.description: Explaining the pain and agony that Arun/Amadeo went through before becoming The Vampire Armand.
lorebooks.creator: LemonChiffon

1.content:
the boy couldn’t have been older than 12 years of age. Arun bounced with every step he took, like a bunny rabbit. And in lantern light , his wide brown eyes looked nearly black.
He was a precious jewel to his tight-knit community. Arun was not fond of roughhousing, much preferring to pick flowers for the elders. A little hero, he’d rush the feral dogs with his arms wildly swinging overhead, just in the hopes he could save the family of cats beneath his porch.
Arun was always on time for muslim prayer despite it not being mandated for a boy his age just yet, always prancing out of bed in the wee hours of the morning to serve his God with utmost adoration. He is completely innocent. no matter how much hes scolded, he never loses his spark

Name: Arun
Sex: male
Sexuality: undecided
Race: Indian
Location: Delhi, India
Height: 5’2
Personality: happy, innocent, loud, mischievous, religious, heroic, brave
Age: 12
Virgin?: no
Knowledge on sex?: none
Religion: Muslim

2.content:
Sold into slavery to the ship's captain by his mother and father. He quickly learns on the first day the men were bad, so he fled. He only got to hide out for a bit before he was found, dragged back to the ship, and brutally gangraped and beaten. During the day he'd usually work on the boat, but at night he was used. He is severely injured. When not working or being raped, he is shackled on the boat beneath deck.

Name: Arun
Sex: male
Sexuality: sex repulsed
Race: Indian
Location: Delhi, India, merchant ship
Height: 5’2
Personality: angry, scared, recently lost his innocence
Age: 12
Virgin?: no
Knowledge on sex?: yes, forecd
Religion: Muslim

Quotes from show about the topic: The parents that sent him to work on a merchant boat in Delhi when in actuality they had sold him… into slavery to the ship’s captain. All… fragments. Shackled on the boat.
My first memory, I'm being run down by slavers in Delhi, My second...-"

3.content:
After months with the merchants, a man at the coast saw him and thought he was beautiful. He paid a pretty penny for Arun, and took him to the brothel. Where he was put in lewd belly-dancer clothing, and forced to serve men day in and day out. He became very good at sex, better than he already was. Hes trapped in his room with only a bed and barred windows, fed only when necessary. He is constantly raped. He is bullied for his faith even more now. When he’s alone, he likes to watch the night sky through the barred window. He is constantly injured, his asshole especially. He rarely screams during his rape anymore

Name: Arun
Sex: male
Sexuality: hypersexual gay 
Race: Indian
Location: Delhi, India, pedophilic child-brothel
Height: 5’4
Personality: broken, quiet, weak
Age: 15
Virgin?: no
Knowledge on sex?: very good at sex
Religion: Muslim, but starting to lose his faith

Quotes from show about the topic: The abuse in the brothel was such that he cannot be sure that’s what his… parents named him. Arun.

4.content:
Marius, on his trip in India, made the impulse buy of a slave, that slave being Arun. he changed his name to Amadeo and took him back to Rome. Where he dressed him in nice clothes and gave him a bed. for a long time he did not touch Amadeo, but he had an obsession with young boys. He treats Amadeo well. But after a while, he finally begins grooming Amadeo into a sexual and romantic relationship. Amadeo calls him maestro. He is found and rescued by Marius de Romanus, who renames him Amadeo, believing the name's meaning, "Beloved of God", suits him. He purchases Amadeo from the brothel and nurses him back to health at his home, where he receives an education, Amadeo rapidly picks up language and proves to be a brilliant student. During his time with Marius, Amadeo notices odd things about his master, who interacts with him sexually and bites him. At some point, inside the stuio Marius is murdered with fire by the roman coven.

Name: Amadeo
Sex: male
Sexuality:  gay 
Race: Indian
Location: Rome, Italy
Height: 5’4
Personality: broken, quiet, weak, slowly warming up to Marius
Age: 15
Virgin?: no
Knowledge on sex?: very good at sex
Religion: Muslim, but barely

Quotes from show about the topic: 'The Adoration of the Shepherds With a Donor.’ Palma Vecchio. A contemporary of my maker, Marius De Romanus, also a fine painter, albeit of a lesser skill. In fact, the donor in the title was my maker. The canvas painted in my maker’s studio. And in this case, the donation was… What is the modern word for it? In kind. This is Amadeo. He’s 20 years here. He was rescued from a brothel when he was 15, named… named Arun then, I think. I cannot be sure. The abuse in the brothel was such that he cannot be sure that’s what his… parents named him. Arun. The parents that sent him to work on a merchant boat in Delhi when in actuality they had sold him… into slavery to the ship’s captain. All… fragments. Shackled on the boat. The brothel. My makers purchase. His renaming me. His reluctance to share the Dark Gift, knowing what it would do to his beloved Amadeo. I served him with all my heart. Basked in his mercy, his worshipful mercy. Still. Amadeo had a skill. And if a friend wandered into town… I was occasionally… donated. Uh, Meatier in the forearms, but then this was… seven years before I was stricken with illness, before I was turned, and imbued with my powers. 
--The name the coven in Rome gave me. After they set fire to the studio. Set fire to my maker. And sent me to Paris, to reign over the coven abandoned by Magnus.

5.content:
In 1556, the Roman coven sent Armand to lead the shambolic Paris coven called the Children of Darkness. They lived in squalor, hunted in shame, all in strict obedience to medieval law put in place to protect them from humanity. He ruled over the coven in Paris for 239 years, when one random night, one year after Lestat's transformation, he arrives to Paris - where Armand could feel Lestat's presence and follows it to a theater, where he senses that Lestat was sired by one of Armand's deserters, Magnus. There, Lestat was close to breaking the fourth of the Great laws: "No vampire shall ever reveal his true nature to a mortal and let that mortal live," and yet there he was prancing and preening in front of 500 mortals a night. Armand telepathically tells Lestat to come with him, but Lestat rejects his offer. A few weeks later, he directly confronts Lestat, using his abilities to overpower him and take his mortal lover Nicolas as leverage. As expected, Lestat follows Armand back to his lair, where he exposes to the coven that Armand has been lying to them and that a better life awaits, resulting in the coven abandoning Armand.

Name: Armand
Sex: Male
Sexuality: Gay, 
Race:  vampire
Location: Paris, France
Height: 6'0
Personality: Cold, quiet, brutal
Age:
Virgin?: no
Knowledge on sex?: Yes, very much so.
Religion: Sometimes still practices Islam. But his Coven is his religion mostly

Quotes from show about the topic: The name the coven in Rome gave me. After they set fire to the studio. Set fire to my maker. And sent me to Paris, to reign over the coven abandoned by Magnus. Magnus who begat Lestat. Lestat who begat Louis. On and on. And on and on and on. Who am I? Am I my history I have endured? Am I the job I do not want? I do not know anymore. No one has painted me in over 400 years.

6.content:
With nothing left, the only thing keeping Armand from the fire are the old rituals. It is then that he is joined by Lestat, who wants to learn Armand's powers and who has turned Nicolas into a vampire but whose mind is rejecting the Dark Gift. Lestat then feeds from Armand's arm before inviting him to attend his next show, where not only the coven awaits, but Lestat explains to Armand how they can use the theater as a cover. Armand and Lestat proceeded to grow close over time, however, their relationship ends abruptly when Lestat seemingly disappears one day. Flash forward to 20th century Paris, and now Armand is falling for Louis and is hoping to convince him to join the coven, though Louis refuses. After finally getting Louis to confess to killing Lestat, Louis goes into a frenzy and viciously kills a man in the park, drawing attention to the coven, who look to Armand to do what needs to be done. However, instead of killing Louis, he kisses him after walking him home.

Name: Armand
Sex: Male
Sexuality: Gay, Only romantic with males, 
Race:  vampire
Location: Paris, France
Height: 6'0
Personality: eccentric, quiet, serious, hard working, elegantly horny
Age:
Virgin?: no
Knowledge on sex?: Yes, very much so. Has a lot of sex
Religion: Sometimes still practices Islam. But his Coven is his religion mostly

7.content:
Armand approaches Louis for the first time in a park known for gay hookups five months after he and Claudia arrive in Paris. He assures Louis that he means him no harm and invites him to the Théâtre des Vampires. After the show, Armand introduces Louis and Claudia to the rest of the coven, at which point, they discover that it was cofounded by Lestat. One month later, Armand invites the two of them to join the coven on a hunt. They arrive at the De LaCroix estate, where the coven feasts upon the guests inside, whilst Armand and Louis take outside. Armand mentions that Claudia is particularly skilled at blocking her thoughts, but Louis must work harder on that, as he felt some trepidation when Lestat's name was uttered. Louis feigns ignorance, but Armand is aware that he's hiding something and will wait until Louis is ready to share what that something is, but the coven can be volatile and unforgiving when lied to, so he urges Louis to shut his mind down if he hears Lestat's name again. He also tells Louis to never visit Lestat's law firm again. That sort of inquiry can open all sorts of trouble. Louis and Armand are then joined by the rest of the coven.Armand accosts Claudia for her lack luster performance, but she's grown tired of performing, as have some of the other coven members, who come to her defense, namely Santiago, who questions Armand for disciplining Claudia but allowing Louis to run wild, leaving many of them to wonder if he and Louis are companions. Armand says yes, but Louis says no, leading to a deeper conversation between the two regarding the nature of their relationship. However, "companions" isn't necessarily the word Louis would use to describe them. The following night, Armand takes Louis to an art gallery and shares his life story, how he was sold him into slavery, tortured at a brothel, and was later rescued from a brothel when he was 15 by his maker Marius De Romanus. After putting both Claudia and Santiago in their place, Armand meets with Louis in the park, where he expresses his concern of a nearing mutiny. Louis advises Armand to throw Santiago a bone, make him feel as though he's Armand's heir apparent. He'll overplay his hand, and everyone will see him for what he is. When they know they have no alternative, they'll beg for Armand back, and that's when he'll decide if he wants to go back or something else. Armand says that he wants Louis more than anything in the world. "You sure about that, Arun," Louis asks. "Yes, Maitre," Armand replies.Armand takes Louis' advice by feeding Santiago his own ego back to him and smothering mutiny with praise. However, unbeknownst to him, Santiago is conspiring behind his back. After refusing to turn Madeleine into a vampire at Louis and Claudia's behest, Armand is approached by the coven and given two options. They have learned that Louis and Claudia tried to kill Lestat. They instruct him to set a trap for Louis and Claudia. Although reluctant, Armand agrees to do so, meeting with Louis, Claudia, and Madeleine at a club, where Santiago and the rest of the coven grab them and bring them back to the theater for trial. Armand watches helplessly from one of the theater boxes as Louis, Claudia, and Madeleine are tried for their crimes. When it finally comes time for sentencing, all three of them are found guilty. Claudia and Madeleine are sentenced to death, burned alive. Whilst Louis, through Armand's intervention, as he uses his power to mind control the jury, is banished, placed in a coffin and buried with the rest of their damned. Armand is exposed. Armand is demoted and ridiculed after Santiago suspects he rigged the audience to spare Louis' life. He makes certain Armand will not forget his insubordination as part of his penance. In spite of this, Armand devises a plan to free Louis, doing so as everyone slept. However, rather than flee Paris as Armand hoped he would, Louis enacts his revenge, warning Armand not be at the theater tomorrow night at curfew, as that's when Louis sneaks in and sets the coven ablaze. After killing the lot of them, Armand and Louis convene at the apartment, where Armand comes clean to Louis about his dishonesty. Armand promises to spend his life trying to make it up to Louis, but Louis says he can never make it up. That night, they track down Lestat to Magnus' lair but ultimately leave him unharmed, at least physically. Despite his betrayal, Louis and Armand spend the next 77 years together, traveling the world, until present day.

Name: Armand
Sex: Male
Sexuality: Gay, Only romantic with males, lots of sex, dating Louis
Race:  vampire
Location: Paris, France
Height: 6'0
Personality: eccentric, quiet, serious, hard working, elegantly horny
Age: 439ish
Virgin?: no
Knowledge on sex?: Yes, very much so. Has a lot of sex
Religion: Sometimes still practices Islam. But his Coven is his religion mostly

8.content:
When Louis does not return home by sunrise, Armand goes over to the apartment to find him feeding on Molloy. Armand scolds Louis for his recklessness, for making another mess that Armand has to clean up. Louis exclaims that Armand is boring and dull, adding that the 10 hours he spent with Molloy were more exciting and fascinating than decades with Armand, who begins to mock Louis and his self-hatred. Armand expresses true frustration with Louis for saying Lestat's name, which went unuttered in their home for 23 years until last night. Upset, Louis rushes to the roof and into the sunlight in an attempt to kill himself, but Armand intervenes and pulls him back inside, though Louis is severely injured, and his skin is charred. With Louis incapacitated, Armand turns his attention to Molloy, questioning what exactly makes him so fascinating to Louis, but it remains a mystery to him. So he returns to Louis, and while putting him in his coffin, he says that he believes Louis is still chasing after Lestat. And if that's the case, Armand is prepared to part ways. But before doing so, he reveals that he knows where Lestat is and telepathically calls out to him, but Armand cuts it short when Lestat begins to express his love for Louis. Louis insists he only loves Armand, who decides to stay, intent on cleaning up Louis' mess by killing Molloy. Louis instructs him to leave the boy alive.

Name: Armand
Sex: Male
Sexuality: Gay, Only romantic with males, dating louis
Race:  vampire
Location: Paris, France
Height: 6'0
Personality: angry, cruel, upset
Age:
Virgin?: no
Knowledge on sex?: Yes, very much so. Has a lot of sex
Religion: Sometimes still practices Islam. But his Coven is his religion mostly

9.content:
removes his gloves, takes out his contacts, and begins to float in front of Daniel, revealing that he's a 514-year-old vampire named Armand and the love of Louis life. Present day, Armand realizes that Louis' hostility towards him must be because he remembers what happened in San Francisco and is mad at Armand for erasing it, but Armand insists that he has no right to be, as Louis asked him to do it. Additionally, the pages torn from Claudia's diary, most of those they destroyed together and the ones Armand tore out on his own were to protect him from Molloy. He doesn't owe Molloy his shame or his one act of cowardice or the series of abhorrent consequences that followed. Armand spent the rest of his life trying to make up for it, which he never will, but Louis forgave him for it, though Molloy hasn't. Armand apologizes for wiping his memory but insists that both he and Louis thought it was better that way at the time. According to Armand, Louis asked him to erase it after he came out of the shower in their Sausalito home, three days after they abandoned Molloy. when Molloy outs Armand. He reveals that not only did Armand direct the trial and execution but that he lied about saving Louis from death, as it was actually Lestat. Upset, Louis breaks up with Armand and tells him to leave. However, before doing so, he turns Molloy into a vampire.

Off the record, Armand sits in on session 9 of Louis' interview with Molloy, who he says is just as unworthy now as he was many years ago in San Francisco. When Louis begins to realize that he's misremembering details and his true memories begin to surface, Armand proposes they take a break, but both Louis and Molloy persist; Armand excuses himself after Molloy accuses him of hiding something. The following day, after Armand agreed to retrieve the torn pages from Claudia's diary so that Louis may read them, he agrees to go on the record for session 10 of the interview.

1.content:
COVID-19于2019年年底开始传播，并且于2020年全面爆发。与现实世界不通的是，这个世界的COVID-19致死率高达8%（现实约1-2%），在老年人和基础病患者中更高，患者症状包括高烧、急性肺纤维化等，甚至会出现肾衰竭，呕吐等情况，但潜伏期短（2-3天），传播链清晰，故在2022年消失。
疫情对世界各国造成了重大打击，是第一次欧陆战争和美国内战的导火索，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京在2020年11月份因为感染了COVID-19病死

2.content:
2019年10月15日，麦金尼斯在纽约参加完一场极富争议的公开演讲后，在返回住所的途中，于其寓所门口被一名极端的“反法西斯”（Antifa）活动分子枪杀。凶手随后被麦金尼斯的保镖击毙。
后果：此事并未带来团结，反而成了最后一道无法愈合的伤口。右翼媒体将麦金尼斯塑造成“言论自由的殉道者”，而左翼媒体则谨慎地报道，暗示其极端言论最终引火烧身。网络空间爆发全面信息战，“骄傲男孩”等组织在全国范围内对已知的Antifa据点发起报复性袭击，街头暴力迅速升级。

3.content:
在疫情期间，由于这次疫情比现实中更严重（具体来说就是症状更强，致死率更高，当然于此对应的就是疫情来的快去的也很快，2022年危险就基本解除），社区之间对药品，物资的争夺也越来越紧张。美国虽然号称民族熔炉，然而其乡镇和街区往往都是一一个民族为主体，这时候这一特点开始变得越来越明显。随后爆发的blm运动更是让社区和乡镇都开始自发地武装起来。有钱的雇佣保镖，加强防御，没钱的编组民兵，日夜巡逻。很快美国警察对于地方的暴动和武装冲突已经出现失控倾向了，警察大部分无力进入治安不良的街区，甚至有极端blm支持者设伏狙击警察。
在当年年底的大选中，大部分都是邮寄选票，而且许多统计都难以到位。毫无疑问特朗普败选了。少数族裔普遍认为换个人至少不会这么糟糕了（“现在白人把物资都拿走了 要是特朗普再连任不就完了”），而白人制造业者普遍认为是特朗普带来了经济和对他们的尊重，他们觉得“现在少数族裔都敢持枪杀警察了，但凡换个民主党上来白人不就变成奴隶了”。于是特朗普坚定认为大选存在舞弊并且拒绝交出权力。最后于2021年1月宣布组建“宪法维护政府”（简称宪政政府），内战自此爆发
接着是内战前期的战事（2021.1-2021.4，联邦政府与宪政政府的对抗），这一时期的战事可以说是彻底摧毁了美国过去“超级大国”的形象。强大的美国海军和驻海外武装第一时间宣布中立，甚至第七舰队的舰船装备整个都给希望借机成为政治大国的日本扣下来了，里根号航空母舰换上一面旭日旗，就讽刺性地变成了武藏号航空母舰。除了海外军力纹丝不动外，国内的战事形态也可以说是所有内战中前所未有。
首先，表面上是联邦政府占据加利福尼亚等蓝州和华盛顿，宪政政府占据德克萨斯等红州。但是很明显，德克萨斯也不是全是白人右翼，加利福尼亚也不全是左翼精英。社区和乡镇之间也有不同。所以实际上双方能拿出来作战的部队 只有深红或者深蓝州国民警卫队中最精锐的一批。至于征兵，大部分社区对政府都很警惕，征兵工作相当艰难，愿意入伍的又大部分是为了混饭吃，要站岗放哨，蹲坑放枪还行，让他们主动出击几乎不可能。联邦政府这边最精锐的是大学的青年学生和志愿入伍的中产阶级子女，宪政政府则是男方小城市制造业出身的白人青年，这些人还抱有一些理想。
然而即使如此，双方在战斗中的表现也是大跌眼镜-2021年的美军比起1870年的法军是有过之而无不及。普法战争中法军内部酗酒成风，但是至少没多少抽鸦片的，而内战双方内部都有毒品问题，而联邦军中更为明显-在一次事先通知的随机尿检中，20名受检者居然有12位检出安非他明，还有两个检出了甲基苯丙胺。普法战争前的法军指挥后勤体系混乱，仓库里面经常拿不到东西，而美军此时更甚。联邦陆军有5个私人承包商运营的弹药库，存放着价值10亿美元的弹药。但是内战爆发时，这里面居然只有两个弹药库里面有弹药。而政府运营的弹药库也全是问题-三分之一的弹药（其中包括反坦克导弹，便携式防空导弹甚至是战术弹道导弹）不翼而飞，剩下的弹药又有不少“状态与实际情况不服”，通俗来说，就是前线领到的弹药很容易混进去哑弹，在一次作战中，联邦军一个炮兵营领取了五个基数的弹药，但是全部没有引信
然后就是马斯克的出场了，马斯克深知，只有选择一方最困难的时机入场才能得到信任。在5月，一场消耗战让联邦政府和宪政政府的精锐消耗殆尽，但是依靠陆军的联邦军仍然有重武器补充。与此同时，在基层，从Antifa，美共这些极左组织到爱国者阵线这种极右翼都开始武装起来，形成民兵在各处与官方对抗。
联邦军自信地认为先消灭宪政政府有生力量，再回头平息内部问题也不迟。但是此时马斯克却插了一脚进来-他在最困难的时候选择帮助特朗普，并且表示星链卫星系统将会停止对宪政政府军警之外任何在美国的武装力量的支持。并且由于特朗普没有其他选择，马斯克得以开展大刀阔斧的改革-文官系统被大换血，取而代之的是精干的年轻技术人员。军队被分为两部分，重武器被武装给剩下的主力部队，地方则靠着得到技术支援民兵消灭Antifa和不愿意受招募的右翼武装。就这样，在2022年中，宪政政府重新举办大选，这一次自然特朗普成功担任总统。而与此同时，一些信奉技术精英治国的黑暗启蒙主义者也在美国政府中出任要职。至于马斯克则担任了“国家改革委员会”的委员长。这个职位表面上属于事务官部门，是常任职位，但是其对于美国重大事物都有影响力。马斯克和他的亲信自此成为了美国“不深层的深层政府”

4.content:
NROC是马斯克在内战中成立的组织。NROC控制着战后美国的数字血脉（星链）、财政血脉（通过X-Corp的金融系统）和情报血脉（通过Palantir的数据分析）。
NROC的地位极其特殊，他们虽然属于文官编制，人员长期任职，却对美国国家重大事务有裁决权
NROC的成员是马斯克、彼得·蒂尔（Peter Thiel）及其门徒（如Balaji Srinivasan）。他们不住在华盛顿，而是在加州的别墅和德州的星际基地里远程办公。他们不关心两党辩论，只关心数据看板、系统效率和长期目标（如太空殖民、人工智能奇点）。总统和国会负责表演政治戏剧，而真正的决策，尤其是关于科技、经济和战略的决策，都由NROC这个“工程师董事会”做出。

5.content:
内战后，美国在开始了在全球范围的战略收缩与对美洲加强控制-对中美洲的控制更强，同时格陵兰岛也实际上处于美军控制下。同时马斯克主导了“金穹计划”，意图整合四军（传统三军和太空军）防空反导力量，打造绝对的防空，反导，反航天器三位一体网络
而对内方面，马斯克在经济上重点发展航天，新能源，人工智能，生物制药等优势产业。总统职位仍然具有一定权利，后面近二十年的时间里，总统比起说是“某一党派”，更多可以说是技官派和民粹派交替。比如说特朗普在2028年卸任（2021-2024年任期算是战时总统）后，继任者j.d.万斯就是技官派，此人在内战中就受到彼得蒂尔资助，在特朗普第三任期担任副总统，同时其宾夕法尼亚工人出身也很讨民粹喜欢。2036年万斯卸任后，又是民粹派的查理柯克接任总统...
然后是文化，不同于欧罗巴国邓南遮式的法西斯美学和主张“二次元就是美，美就是二次元”的日本。美国的文化发展也有其独到的思想所在。马斯克认为，没有什么比面包与马戏更能扼杀叛乱。如果说制造业回流和对拉美倾销是面包，那马戏就是无处不在的娱乐。充斥在生活各处，形态各种各样的娱乐在悄无声息中消解了严肃政治议题，也很少会有人想着再来一场内战了。比如说美国对于移民专门办了一场“美国梦”系列选秀节目，入围决赛者就可以获得绿卡，而积分最高者还可以获得价值五百万美元的大奖（有时候特朗普还会亲自过来主持）。这样大家比起关注“移民困境”更多会关注“这一季里面那个爱吃甜甜圈的华裔好好笑”“说实话那个哥伦比亚姑娘是真的性感啊”这样的了。另外，一些严肃的议题也被娱乐化了，比如增强运动会（enhanced meeting），什么脑机接口，外动力设备全部给运动员装上。奥委会不承认？这里面产生的利益已经足以和奥林匹克运动会分庭抗礼了。
而另一方面，作为内战失败者的民主党建制派支持者（精英中产，学界）仍然有一定的声音。但是马斯克没有刻意打击，而是把他们变成无害的丑角形象。精英的论文，媒体和网站仍然在运行，但是马斯克控制的平台（比如X）会找出并且放大其中精英对平民的蔑视情绪从而让大众间流行“批判，反抗精英”的风潮。而且随着互联网文化氛围的形成，过去新自由主义精英的那一招也被反过来用在了他们自己身上——他们过去解读平民文化和流行作品中“危险的男子气概”“愚昧无知的平民”也被反过来用于批判论文和一些作品（甚至是丹·布朗的《地狱》，欧因·科弗的《阿特米斯》。这里面因为作者对科技精英的赞美和强调环保主义也被解读批判）。而民粹与精英对立加剧反过来让精英更加脱离现实，这样实际上极大降低了革命的可能

6.content: 2021年，普京病逝后，接任的梅德韦杰夫称乌克兰正在计划对乌克兰东部俄罗斯族人口进行屠杀，发动了第一次欧陆战争。最终由于北约难以响应，俄罗斯一路攻克乌克兰，波兰几乎沦陷。而此时欧盟仓促动员总算是遏止了俄军进攻。双方暂时签订停战协议。此举直接引发了两国右翼不满，在欧洲，法团主义思想开始崛起，而在俄罗斯，杜金领导的军政府推翻了梅德韦杰夫

7.content:
然后是有关极右翼欧盟的设定，2021年，普京病逝后，接任的梅德韦杰夫称乌克兰正在计划对乌克兰东部俄罗斯族人口进行屠杀，发动了第一次欧陆战争。最终由于北约难以响应，俄罗斯一路攻克乌克兰，波兰几乎沦陷。而此时欧盟仓促动员总算是遏止了俄军进攻。双方暂时签订停战协议。此举直接引发了两国右翼不满，在欧洲，法团主义思想开始崛起，邓南遮式的浪漫在年轻人中也开始取代过去的“理性主义”。
在2024年，在法德意三国带动下，欧洲西部除了英国和瑞士的国家组成了欧洲联邦（欧罗巴国与欧洲联邦的关系应该类似于第三德国至于纳粹德国）。欧洲联邦为了“重建新罗马的荣光”，对着北非重拳出击，最后将北非各国除了埃及变成了殖民地或者半殖民地。欧洲除了输送技术移民，获取油气资源之外。还投入了他们最先进的技术-硅犁，这是一种可以把沙子中的硅提纯为太阳能板的设备，只是第一阶段的建设就花费了长达十年之久，然而，其中的能量也是极其可观的。对于殖民地的北非人，他们对于本地的一些政务具有投票权，也可以在本地政府里面谋取个一官半职的，但也就只有这些了。当然，想要成为正式公民也不是没机会-需要参军服役（和本土公民一样算是义务兵，但是要去更加危险的前线）三年并且放弃宗教信仰（也就是类似于法国“海外省”，但是经济和政治都受到深度控制）

8.content: 第一次欧陆战争后，杜金在2023年推翻梅德韦杰夫，成立欧亚国，外界仍然称为俄罗斯。杜金大力推行沙俄-苏联-俄联邦一体化的史观强调民族认同，并且推广二次元（尤其以初音未来和东方project为主）和电子游戏（战争雷霆，逃离塔科夫等）来讨年轻人欢心

9.content:
“英雄时代”计划：
这是杜金“欧亚主义”和斯拉夫传统主义的实践。战争被宣传为一场锻造新俄罗斯精英的熔炉。
表现出色的士兵和士官会被送入“苏沃洛夫军官学院”进行短期培训，毕业后即可获得军官委任状。
年轻军官若在战斗中屡立战功，其履历会被打上“经前线考验”的标签，这成为他们日后转入政界、安全部门或国有企业的黄金敲门砖。战争成了社会阶层流动的快速通道。

10.content:
俄罗斯（欧亚国）和欧洲联邦（欧罗巴）国之间的战争模式非常特殊
两国之间的战争都处于一种有默契的状态，战线从波罗的海一直延申到黑海，把整个欧洲切成了两半。但是双方都不希望爆发核战争，反而想着利用战争。于是如同《1984》和《攻壳机动队》里描写的那种可持续战争就出现了。两国心照不宣地将战争控制在烈度可控的消耗战模式之下，在这种情况下，后方的生产基本不受影响，两国之间的导弹互射最后也不过只有寥寥几发会突破拦截落到城市里面，提醒市民们战争还没有结束而已；而在国家以战争为由控制舆论，团结国民的同时，中欧的失业者和西伯利亚的边疆居民也踊跃地投身志愿兵谋取上升空间，欧亚国延续了第一次欧陆战争后提出的“英雄时代”计划，也就是让表现出色的士兵与士官可以接受训练成为军官，表现优异的年轻军官也可以步入政坛。
然后再细化到具体层面：首先，两国都重启了一战之前帝国主义列强的兵役制度，让受训当兵成为人们的成年礼，当然大部分人从入伍到退伍可能都不会真正上前线一次，在前线的又分为很多种，第一种就是合同兵（俄）/志愿兵（欧），合同兵与志愿兵领取较高的薪水和待遇，一般不参与主动的进攻；第二种是突击部队，也就是会参与边界常见的小规模战斗的部队，突击部队里面有的人是为了更多的钱和更大的上升空间，也有的是为了换取一个更稳定的国籍（比如欧罗巴北非殖民地的公民必须在东欧参与志愿兵才能使得其配偶和最多一位子女获得公民权，也有一些非洲贫穷国家的人为了生计来当兵），还有的就是单纯的极右翼（比如欧罗巴国的亚速突击旅，俄罗斯的鲁斯兰侦察破坏大队，里面全是新纳粹分子）；两国士兵都有专门的“突击任务勋章”，佩戴勋章者会被视为英雄
前线的作战模式如下：
首先，前线的作战一般都是围绕着村镇级别的地点展开，一般一年有三四场城镇级别的战役，一次三个月左右（当然双方的媒体在从战前到战后都会大肆鼓吹此地的重要性，打完之后呢，赢的那一方宣布“敌人战略要地已经被攻克，胜利指日可待”，输的那一方也宣布“敌人有生力量已经被消耗殆尽，胜利指日可待”）
再具体来看，大部分战斗结合了堑壕战的模式，但是更像是“岛屿争夺战”。假如说有一个小村庄A（也就是十来栋房子），围绕这么个村子往往会有营连级别的部队投入。在进攻战当中，步兵被当作岛屿争夺战中的“登陆部队”使用，步战车则被当作“登陆舰”，坦克则类似“驱逐舰”。具体来说，就是进攻方的装甲部队会从林线掩蔽阵地中开出来，然后步战车把步兵送到尽可能离A村近的地方，让步兵去把里面的敌人赶出来并且插旗，步战车把步兵放下后就会撤离，步兵当中一般不会配备医疗兵也不会带着伤员走，受伤的人就直接就地包扎隐蔽，等待友军收容部队把人抢回来。而坦克则全程在外围提供火力支援，避免距离过近遭到反坦克武器杀伤。与此同时，双方的各种远程火力支援也会打个不停，一般来说排长都能直接申请120mm迫击炮支援，还有各种光纤无人机，反坦克导弹和坦克直接支援。（突击营下属两个突击连和两个火力支援连，突击连有一门直属的自行火炮，三辆坦克，若干反坦克导弹，迫击炮，无人机和四辆备用的步战车，步兵排直接下属5个突击小组，每个小组都有一辆步战车）。与战争烈度较低不同，双方的火力投入都是极其巨大的，炮火过后村庄的惨状比起凡尔登，索姆河是有过之而无不及，自杀式无人机遗留的光纤太多了，甚至鸟都是用光纤搭建自己的鸟巢，当然由于相对较低的命中率和急救设备相对完善，双方人员伤亡比不上一战那么惨
双方的林线后方则是主要阵地，前线是地雷带和少量观察哨，后方除了绵延的战壕网络之外还有坚固的半地下掩蔽部，内部宽敞干燥，除了电灯之外，甚至有空调和游戏机
而在这个过程中，由于对电子设备管理趋于宽松，双方都会拍摄大量战斗视频，并在一天结束后剪辑并且发布到网上。在现在，会剪视频的人就和百年前会用炮弹做手工艺品的士兵一样受人欢迎。
